cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking generally west-northwest, expected to turn west and make landfall on the south-central Texas coast then move inland toward northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Corpus Christi, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas (includes Houston/Galveston area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central and upper Texas coastline from the Rio Grande valley through Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Low (3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy 20–30 mph gusts possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding and elevated tides (<3 ft) possible along the upper Texas coast and Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain forecast for the upper Texas coast, locally higher, which could cause urban and low-lying area flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; potential lightning and localized squalls affecting cargo handling operations.
